hints.0: For most farms, larger size means more production. Berry gatherers are an exception to this rule.
hints.1: More and different monsters will spawn as you recruit more colonists.
hints.10: 3x33 is the optimal size for a forester.
hints.16: Use the compass to find your way towards different colonies and outposts.
hints.17: Use the astrolabe to find the different regions with unique resources.
hints.18: Build the Sacred Failsafe and spend Sacred Points to save your colony when it is getting overrun by monster
hints.19: Place the Sacred Storage to store more Sacred Points
hints.2: Certain layers of the world contain ores. Dig deeper to find different ores.
hints.20: Use blue, green, red and white paint to colour items like doors and windows
hints.21: Use paint stripper to remove the colours you've added to items.
hints.22: Elevators can't be used by colonists, but they are a quick way of moving up and down for players.
hints.23: Build rails and rail stations to quickly move from A to B.
hints.24: Use rail gates to make an impenetrable barrier for monsters, without stopping rail carts
hints.25: Place the statistics board to get detailed information on your colony.
hints.26: Place the Archimedean Screw to remove all nearby water.
hints.27: We write a periodic Friday Blog. Find it on steam to learn more about the development of Colony Survival!
hints.28: There are mods for Colony Survival. Find them on the Steam Forums or Discord!
hints.4: Click on 'job blocks' to see how they're used and to prioritize certain recipes.
hints.7: Differences in range, reloading speed and damage give every type of guard unique benefits and drawbacks.

bannerclickedpopup.deletecolonydescription: Deleting the last banner of a colony will remove all npcs and make the colony unusable. To confirm this is what you want, type 'delete' below.
bannerclickedpopup.noconfirmationdelete: Ignoring deletion command, did not get confirmation
bannerclickedpopup.placementfail: Couldn't place banner at this location

bannerplacementpopup.mustbeleader: Must be the colony leader to adjust banners

managejobs.header_text: {0} Laborers without a job. Enabled jobs: {1} / {2}. Filled jobs: {3} / {1}

outpost.createdescription: Starting an outpost consumes an Outpost Banner from your inventory (or stockpile).

colonymanagement.recruitfailedbeds: <color=#ff2323>Couldn't recruit a new colonist - not enough free beds.</color>
colonymanagement.recruitfailedcap: <color=#ff2323>Couldn't recruit a new colonist - reached capacity.</color>
colonymanagement.recruitfailednomeals: <color=#ff2323>Couldn't recruit a new colonist - not enough meals in stockpile.</color>
colonymanagement.recruittext3: Colonists require a meal per day and a bed.
colonymanagement.recruittext4-2: Recruiting the next colonist costs {0} meals.
colonymanagement.recruittext5-2: There are {0} spare beds and you can recruit {1} more colonists before reaching max population.
colonymanagement.recruittext6: Recruiting the next {0} colonists is free.

science.incomingdescription2: They will share their science with you
science.outgoingdescription2: You provide them with your science
science.selectcolony: Select a colony to send science to

start.defaultkit: First time starter kit is used
start.name: Colony Name

trading.ruledescription: Traders will trade {0} from {1} to {2} if both of the following:
trading.ruleincomingdescr2: Get {0} if they have more than {1} and we have less than {2}.
trading.rulemaximumtraded: This deal will send up to the following amount of items in total:
trading.ruleoutgoingdescr2: Send {0} if we have more than {1} and they have less than {2}.
trading.selectcolony: Select a colony to trade to

commands.disableachievements: Achievements have been disabled for this world due to interacting with cheat options
commands.disableachievementsfirst: To do that, you must first disable achievements by using the '/disableachievements' command
commands.nopermission: You do not have the permission '{0}' to do that.

connectingscreen.sp_alreadyrunning2: A server is already running. Returning to the main menu in 5 seconds.

stages.fail: Loading failed, returning to main menu in 5 seconds
stages.local1: Searching for singleplayer server on this computer
stages.local2: Searching for online server on this computer
stages.timeout: Connecting timed out. Returning to main menu in 5 seconds

failsafe.current: Current Sacred Points storage: {0} out of {1}
failsafe.damage: Triggering the Sacred Failsafe will cause {0} damage
failsafe.futurewave: The Failsafe will reduce the total HP of incoming monsters by {0:P0} for the next night
failsafe.nextavailable: The Failsafe will be available again after the next night
failsafe.statusactive: Status: Sacred Failsafe has been activated
failsafe.wave: The current threat level is {0} and will spawn monsters with a total HP of {1}
failsafe.wavereduced: The total HP of incoming monsters will be reduced by {0:P0} the next night

general.gamepadtextinputalphanumeric: Only alphabet letters and numbers are accepted.

notifications.missingplayerammo: <color=#ff2323>Using {0} requires some {1} to be in the inventory!</color>

npc_died.individual: {0}: A colonist with job {1} died from: {2}

alarmbell.description: Unlocks the Alarm Bell, which will ring a bell when walked upon by a monster
alarmbell.name: Alarm Bell

animalcarcass.description: Provides a source for animal carcasses
animalcarcass.name: Local Animal Carcass

anvil.description: Unlocks the Anvil, an important source of more advanced products like Copper Tools
anvil.name: Anvil

archery.description: Unlocks archers and fletchers, a more effective protection against monsters.
archery.name: Archery

artist.description: Unlocks a new job that is completely dedicated to aesthetics
artist.name: Artist

astrolabe.description: Unlocks the astrolabe; a navigation tool that helps find biomes
astrolabe.name: Astrolabe

blastfurnace.description: Unlocks a rapid way to smelt advanced metals.
blastfurnace.name: Blast Furnace

brass.description: Unlocks brass, a relatively soft alloy. It’s not suited for weapons or tools, but its malleability makes it perfect for small detailed parts. It requires zinc, which can be purchased or mined below mammoth trees.
brass.name: Brass

bread.description: Unlocks the making of bread. Use grindstones to make flour, which can then be used by the cook to make bread.
bread.name: Bread

bricks.description: Allows baking clay into new types of blocks
bricks.name: Bricks

bronze.description: Unlocks a way to make copper stronger, by mixing it with the rare and valuable tin
bronze.name: Bronze Age

bronzelockbox.description: Unlocks the Bronze Lockbox. Improved version of the Copper Lockbox. More storage, more efficiency, less threatening.
bronzelockbox.name: Bronze Lockbox

caltrop.description: Unlocks a trap that once loaded will slow monsters below it
caltrop.name: Caltrops

chestluxury.description: Unlocks Luxury Chests, which are necessary to unlock advanced technology.
chestluxury.name: Luxury Chest

chestprestige.description: Abandon all hope of reward and proportion, ye who enter here! Prestige Chests are necessary for Prestige Science. It’s a stretch goal for enthusiastic colonies.
chestprestige.name: Prestige Chest

chestresource.description: Unlocks Science Chests, which are necessary to unlock advanced technology
chestresource.name: Science Chest

chickenmeal.description: Unlocks a more complex meal which yields more Sacred Points when consumed by colonists
chickenmeal.name: Chicken Meals

classical.description: Revive the way the ancients built
classical.name: Classical Architecture

compass.description: Unlocks the compass; a navigation tool to find back your home
compass.name: Compass

constructionbuilder.description: Unlock builder areas for the construction worker
constructionbuilder.name: Builder

constructiondigger.description: Unlock digger areas for the construction worker
constructiondigger.name: Digger

cook.description: Unlocks the cook and the fisherman, new sources of meals for your colonists
cook.name: Cook

copperlockbox.description: Unlocks the Copper Lockbox. While placed it increases the colony point capacity. Warning: every placed lockbox will lure more monsters to your colony!
copperlockbox.name: Copper Lockbox

cotton.description: Unlocks a source of high quality textiles. Cotton plants only grow in heaths.
cotton.name: Cotton

dyeing.description: Learn to grow flowers in marshes, allowing you to add color to your world.
dyeing.name: Dyeing

elevator.description: Unlocks elevator production, useful for traversing vertical distances
elevator.name: Elevator

elevatorhorizontal.description: Unlocks rail production, useful for traversing horizontal distances
elevatorhorizontal.name: Rails

engineer.description: Unlocks the engineer and the trapfixer. The engineer makes traps and their ammo, which can be used to fight monsters. The trapfixer will load and reload nearby traps.
engineer.name: Engineer

failsafe.description: Unlocks the Sacred Failsafe, an emergency tool that uses Sacred Points to eliminate monsters
failsafe.name: Sacred Failsafe

farming.description: Unlocks the wheat farmer. Wheat will grow in importance as food over time.
farming.name: Wheat Farming

fence.description: Could be very practical, but is mostly aesthetic.
fence.name: Fence

furnace.description: Unlocks the smelter, a worker who processes ores
furnace.name: Smelter

glassblower.description: Unlocks a way to craft glass
glassblower.name: Glassblower

glider.description: Unlocks glider production, allowing unpowered flight from higher points
glider.name: Glider

glidersteel.description: Unlocks a launcher that quickly shoots gliders to tremendous heights.
glidersteel.name: Launched Steel Glider

goldenstatue.description: Unlocks the Threat Banner, which will attract monsters from other outposts to the one it's placed in.
goldenstatue.name: Threat Banner

grassdirt.description: Provides a source for grass and dirt
grassdirt.name: Grass & Dirt Production

grenadelauncher.description: Unlocks a powerful weapon which can eliminate groups of enemies at a distance.
grenadelauncher.name: Grenade Launcher

guntrap.description: Unlocks a powerful trap which does enormous amounts of damage.
guntrap.name: Cannon Trap

hemp.description: Unlocks the cultivation of hemp plants in marshes as well as purchasing it. Leads towards processing it into ropes and paper.
hemp.name: Hemp

iron.description: A major step forward for your colony, unlocking a new material which is required in many items
iron.name: Iron Age

jewellery.description: Unlocks the Jeweler, who creates delicate things
jewellery.name: Jeweler

jewelry.description: Unlocks jewelry, a good product for trade
jewelry.name: Jewelry

lanterns.description: Unlocks lanterns, useful for lighting up places
lanterns.name: Lanterns

lathe.description: Unlocks a complex machine which allows colonists to rapidly make detailed metal parts.
lathe.name: Metal Lathe

miner.description: Unlocks the miner. When placed on a dark stone block, a colonist will come to mine that material continuously.
miner.name: Miner

monocular.description: Unlocks a nifty tool which can be used to observe things in the distance
monocular.name: Monocular

mudbricks.description: Unlocks mudbricks, a cheap and simple building material
mudbricks.name: Mudbricks

musket.description: Unlocks a new gunpowder weapon. Does less damage than a handcannon but the ammo is cheaper, it has a larger range and it’s quicker to reload.
musket.name: Musket

nitro.description: Unlocks a highly explosive compound essential for smokeless powder. It’s a lot less messy than traditional gunpowder, allowing for the development of more sophisticated firearms with many moving parts.
nitro.name: Nitrocellulose

npcshop.description: Unlocks the Grocery Shop, a place where colonists can receive their daily meals. If none are found, they'll visit the banner.
npcshop.name: Grocery Shop

outposts.description: Unlocks Outpost Banners. They can be placed to expand the colony, both close and further away.
outposts.name: Outposts

papermaking.description: Unlocks making paper from hemp, a key part towards scientific progress
papermaking.name: Paper Production

poison.description: Unlocks poison processing, useful for inflicting damage to monsters over time. Wisteria plants can only be grown in heaths. Each wisteria harvester needs 10 wisteria plants nearby to function well.
poison.name: Poison

porridge.description: Unlocks combining water and wheat into a new meal type
porridge.name: Porridge

pottery.description: Unlocks pottery, used to carry things around, and earthenware that can be sold
pottery.name: Pottery

prestige1.description: A goal to organize and measure the best of our energies and skills!
prestige1.name: Prestige I

prestige2.description: It’s not the destination that matters: it’s the journey.
prestige2.name: Prestige II

prestige3.description: This place is a place of honor. A highly esteemed deed is commemorated here.
prestige3.name: Prestige III

prestige4.description: The last mile is the longest!
prestige4.name: Prestige IV

prestige5.description: Congratulations! You successfully completed all stretch goals.
prestige5.name: Prestige V

printingpress.description: Unlocks the printing press, a complex machine that allows you to scale up the production of Books of Knowledge. Also unlocks brass precision parts, which are required for a lot of other machines.
printingpress.name: Printing Press

projectiletrap.description: Unlocks a trap that once loaded will shoot sideways at strong monsters
projectiletrap.name: Projectile Trap

recursiveknowledge.description: Helps make books by using books so you can make more books
recursiveknowledge.name: Recursive Self-Improvement

researcher.description: Unlocks the researcher, who will do research using nearby bookcases to progress science
researcher.name: Researcher

roofs.description: An attractive way to cover your buildings
roofs.name: Tiled Roofs

ropes.description: Unlocks an ingredient with many uses
ropes.name: Ropes

ropetrap.description: Unlocks a trap that freezes nearby monsters for 10 seconds when one monster passes over it.
ropetrap.name: Rope Trap

sacredhouse.description: Unlocks the Sacred Point Storage, to extend the amount of Sacred Points which can be used by the Failsafe
sacredhouse.name: Sacred Point Storage

scribe.description: Unlocks the scribe, who studies scrolls to gain new insights. A scribe requires 10 Scrolls Shelves nearby. The scribe empties them, but they automatically fill themselves up again over time.
scribe.name: Scribe

signs.description: Time to put your name on things
signs.name: Signs

statistics.description: Unlocks the Statistics Board. When placed and used, it gives insights into the activity of your colony.
statistics.name: Statistics Board

steel.description: Unlocks steel, lead and mineral oil. These resources are necessary for the construction of more modern machinery. Lead ore is found in marshes, and coal is located below mammoth trees.
steel.name: Steel, Lead and Mineral Oil

steellockbox.description: Unlocks a lockbox with more capacity.
steellockbox.name: Steel Lockbox

steeltools.description: Unlocks a more durable tool which allows colonists to do their work more efficiently.
steeltools.name: Steel Tools

stonemason.description: Unlocks the stonemason, useful for adding variety to buildings
stonemason.name: Stonemason

tabulator.description: Unlocks a complex machine which processes data and stores it in punched-cards.
tabulator.name: Tabulating Machine

tailoring.description: Unlocks the tailor, a worker who can turn flax into linen and other items. Linen is a good source of colony points
tailoring.name: Tailor

tanner.description: Unlocks the tanner, a worker who is vital in the production of leather and, later, parchment
tanner.name: Tanner

toolshop.description: Unlocks the Tool Distribution Table, a place where colonists will go to take tools when used. If none are found, they'll go to the banner.
toolshop.name: Tool Distribution

trader.description: Used to accelerate trade deals between colonies. Not used for trading with outposts; intended for multiplayer.
trader.name: Trader

trading.description: Unlocks the Merchant's Hub, a place where you can buy and sell items
trading.name: Merchant's Hub

waterpump.description: Allows gathering water away from water sources
waterpump.name: Water pumping

watersponge.description: Removes water in its local area in a deeply realistic way
watersponge.name: Archimedean Screw

writer.description: Unlocks the writer, parchment and scrolls of knowledge. These are important to complete more advanced science.
writer.name: Writer

inventory.madeintooltippurchasable: Purchasable at the Merchant Hub for {0} points
inventory.trashicon: Drop items here to trash them

itemselector.description: Select an item type to use

limits.description: Colonists will work until the set amount is reached in the stockpile.
limits.group2: Select one of multiple groups for this specific worker. Adjusting limits will adjust them for all workers of this type with the same group.

hoverpriority.b:
Recipes with a +++ priority are crafted first.
Recipes with a + priority are crafted last.

limits.wrongcolony: Selected crafting job is part of another colony

specialblockremoval.description: Removing this block of type {0} may cause problems for a colony. What do you want to do?

toolconstruction.description: Select the type of area you want to create.
toolconstruction.shapemenudescription: Select the shape to use for the next areas

tooljob.berrya: Quick and easy food, start with this!
tooljob.buildera: Fill an area of the world
tooljob.builderb: Opens a menu to select the type, then select the area to fill
tooljob.builderreplacerb: Select an area in which to replace one type of block with another
tooljob.construction2: This will open another menu where you can select the construction type
tooljob.constructionjobb: Place next to a construction area
tooljob.description: Select the type of area you want to create.
tooljob.diggera: Dig out an area of the world
tooljob.diggerb: Select the area to dig out
tooljob.diggerspeciala: Remove a specific type in an area
tooljob.diggerspecialb: Select the area to remove it from
tooljob.dyer1: Add colors to make life a little less drab
tooljob.dyer2: This will open another menu with multiple farm jobs
tooljob.foresterb: Requires an axe and arable ground
tooljob.wateradjacent: Requires water adjacent to the job location

toolshop.description: Adjust the minimum required stockpile levels before colonists use specific tools. Allows them to be used for crafting or science.

page1_2.text1_2: Start by finding a good spot for your first colony. Having water and flat fields for farming nearby is recommended. A Banner will be the center of your colony.
page1_2.text2_2gamepad: Select the Banner Tool in the inventory below using <style=Player/HotBarUp> and <style=Player/HotBarDown>. Place it with <style=Player/FireSecondary> while aiming at the ground with the Banner Tool selected. Once in a Colony, the Banner Tool displays a deep shadow wherever monsters may spawn later.
page1_2.text2_2keyboard: Select the Banner Tool in the inventory below using <style=Player/Inventory1>. Place it with <style=Player/FireSecondary> while aiming at the ground with the Banner Tool selected. Once in a Colony, the Banner Tool displays a deep shadow wherever monsters may spawn later.
page1_2.text3_2: Place beds to be able to recruit colonists. Press <style=Player/ToggleInventory> to open the interface. Move beds from the stockpile to the hotbar below. With the bed selected, use <style=Player/FireSecondary> while aiming at ground to place a bed.
page1_2.text4: Open the interface and go to the 'Colony' page. Press 'recruit' to recruit a colonist.

page2_2.description: These are essential for growth and survival
page2_2.text1: Colonists require 1 meal per day. They grab these at the banner or a nearby grocery store. Without food, colonists starve. Recruiting new colonists costs multiple meals.
page2_2.text2_2gamepad: The berry farmer is the first food source. Select the Command Tool (the first inventory slot). <style=Player/FirePrimary> to open it and select the berry farmer. <style=Player/FireSecondary> to start defining the berry farm, then <style=Player/FireSecondary> again elsewhere to finish. You’ll need quite a lot of these!
page2_2.text2_2keyboard: The berry farmer is the first food source. Select the Command Tool (<style=Player/Inventory0>). <style=Player/FirePrimary> to open it and select the berry farmer. <style=Player/FireSecondary> to start defining the berry farm, then <style=Player/FireSecondary> again elsewhere to finish. You’ll need quite a lot of these!
page2_2.text3_2: To start producing beds, you’ll have to craft a tinkerer’s table. Holding <style=Player/FirePrimary> while aiming at blocks will allow you to dig down to gather the required stone rubble.
page2_2.text4: Click on the tinkerer’s table icon on the left of the stockpile to craft it. Place it like you placed the bed. Like with the berry farm, unemployed colonists will automatically take this job.

page3_2.text1: Workers will go to crates both to gather ingredients from the stockpile and to deliver crafted products to the stockpile. If there aren't any crates yet, the banner will function as one.
page3_2.text2: A lot of jobs can or must use tools. Different tools have different costs, durabilities and production speed bonuses. The tinkerer automatically produces stone tools.
page3_2.text3: Use science to unlock new jobs, items and features. Open the science page in the interface to check the requirements and unlock new technology when it becomes available.
page3_2.text4: When you’ve unlocked the Miner science, the tinkerer will produce “miner jobs”. Dig down and place these on dark stone blocks or ores to have colonists mine them sustainably.

page4_2.description: Defend your colony against the monsters of the night!
page4_2.text1: Unlocking some science will add 'threat'. This is shown in the top-right of the UI. Recruiting extra colonists will add threat at a slow pace after the first 25. As the threat level rises, more and stronger monsters will appear.
page4_2.text2: Build walls and dig moats in the monster-free zone to protect the center of your colony. Feel free to place jobs like farms in the “monster zone” outside of this: colonists will leave this area and go to their beds when the night starts.
page4_2.text3: Your tinkerer will produce the item 'Night Slinger Guard'. Place this in your colony to recruit a slinger who works during the night.
page4_2.text4: Progress in the tech tree to unlock new guards, traps and the Sacred Failsafe.

page5_2.description: Trade and expand to get access to unique resources
page5_2.text1_2: Unlock and place the Merchant’s Hub. Use <style=Player/FireSecondary> to open its interface. Sell items to earn Colony Points. Among others, points can be spent on upgrades like the colonist limit in the Colony Points page.
page5_2.text2: This world contains multiple regions with unique resources. There are mountaintops covered with snow, heaths covered in purple, marshes and mammoth trees. Unlock and equip the astrolabe to find them easily.
page5_2.text3: Unlock outposts, purchase an Outpost Banner and carry it with you while you explore. Place it to start an Outpost. Its stockpile and scientific progress are shared with the main colony and other outposts. Build outposts in the regions mentioned above to get access to their resources.

page6_2.text1: For some jobs, you have to place both the 'harvester' and the 'source' block. Most of the time each harvester block needs about 10 source blocks.
page6_2.text2: A harvester block like the Scribe's Desk recruits a colonist to work there. That colonist will try to visit a nearby source block, in this case a filled Scroll Shelf, before crafting.
page6_2.text3: Harvesters empty their source blocks, but source blocks automatically regenerate over time. The 1 to 10 ratio ensures a sustainable long term balance.

languagemenu.coverage: This locale is {0:F1}% complete. To help localize this, see the forums or our repository on github
languagemenu.wiptext: Work in progress. This does not cover all text in the game, and some translations may cover less than others.

videomenu.restarttoapply: (*) Requires game restart to apply fully

singleplayermenu.confirmdeletedescription:
You're about to delete the folder containing this world.
What do you want to do?
singleplayermenu.legacyworldhint: You've selected a legacy world. To load this you'll need to run an older version of Colony Survival. You can set Steam to download old versions by going into the games' properties and selecting an older version in the beta's tab there.

modschanged.disabled: '{0}' is disabled or missing but previously used.
modschanged.main:
Loading world '{0}' but some mods changed.
This may cause problems.

tooltip.craftingblock: Orders a colonist to work here as a {0}
tooltip.crate: Colonists will move to one of these blocks to get or deposit items every so often
tooltip.guard-general: Orders a colonist to guard this position
tooltip.is-edible: Meal item, colonists will eat one meal every day
tooltip.is-sanctified: Receive {0} sacred points when colonists eat this meal
tooltip.miner: Orders a colonist to repeatedly mine the dark stone ore block underneath
tooltip.npcshop: Colonists will visit this or the banner to get their daily meal
tooltip.pointtrader: You can buy and sell things for points here
tooltip.requires-water: Must be placed next to water to function
tooltip.statisticsboard: Interact with this block to view statistics of your colony
tooltip.threatstatue-general: Pulls threat from other outposts towards the outpost it's placed in, while also causing some threat itself
tooltip.tool-always-usable: Always available, does not require items
tooltip.tool-general: Tools are used by many jobs to accelerate crafting
tooltip.toolshop: Colonists will visit this or the banner to get new tools when needed
tooltip.trap-explosive-range: Affects an area with radius {0} on hit
tooltip.trap-filter-1000hp: Only triggers on monsters with at least 1000 hp
tooltip.trap-filter-unslowed: Only triggers on monsters not yet slowed
tooltip.trapfixer: Orders a colonist to restock nearby traps during the day
tooltip.trap-general: Trap item, awaits monsters to pass along and triggers. They will be refilled during the day by Trapfixer colonists
tooltip.trap-slows: Slows monsters to {0} times their speed
tooltip.trap-style-front: Triggers from monsters to the front

typeuses.alarmbell: Rings an alarm when it detects monsters walking over it
typeuses.alkanet: In real life, a source of red dye
typeuses.astrolabe: Equip in the hotbar to see the way to special biomes
typeuses.berry: A single berry. Not worth the effort of eating it!
typeuses.berrybush: Colonists can plant these for easy food
typeuses.berrymeal: A bunch of berries prepared to form a delicious meal
typeuses.bookcase: These are 'harvested' by researchers and automatically regenerate their content. Placing 10 of them for every researcher ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.bookcase1: These are 'harvested' by researchers and automatically regenerate their content. Placing 10 of them for every researcher ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.bookcase2: These are 'harvested' by researchers and automatically regenerate their content. Placing 10 of them for every researcher ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.bookcasefilled: These are 'harvested' by researchers and automatically regenerate their content. Placing 10 of them for every researcher ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.bread: A dry piece of bread without any spread or filling. Bleh
typeuses.breadmeal: Bread made tasty with a perfect berry jam
typeuses.bricks: It's a Dutch game, after all
typeuses.cherryblossom: The pinkest thing in the game
typeuses.clay: I wish you could touch it
typeuses.coalore: Warning: might cause climate problems. Can be found directly below mammoth trees.
typeuses.compass: Equip in the hotbar to see the way to colonies and outposts
typeuses.copper: Somewhat soft metal, but quite useful
typeuses.coppertools: You can't even cut bread without tools
typeuses.failsafe: Emergency defense mechanism using Sacred Points
typeuses.furnace: Uses firewood as fuel to craft bronze ingots and bricks
typeuses.glider: Places a glider launcher; Enter one using <style=Player/FireSecondary> and navigate by aiming while holding forward
typeuses.glidersteel: Like the regular glider launcher, but this one launches you much higher into the air
typeuses.goldingot: Was once used to guarantee the value of paper money
typeuses.goldore: Can also be found in ore beneath snowy mountains
typeuses.grindstone: Used to grind wheat into flour
typeuses.hollyhock: A laxative in real life. Not in-game. Yet.
typeuses.ironore: Mined with an iron pickaxe that's made of iron ore
typeuses.lanternred: These are popular in Amsterdam too
typeuses.leavestaiga: I've got a Christmas feeling now
typeuses.leavestemperate: Try to jump into a pile of these from a high tower
typeuses.linen: Lingerie means underwear made of linen
typeuses.logtemperate: Like an output log, but different
typeuses.monocular: Equip in the hotbar to take a closer look at the world
typeuses.npcshop: Colonists visit here once a day to gather food and happiness items
typeuses.planks: Now with 4 times the volume of logs!
typeuses.railgate: Allows rail travel while blocking travel by foot
typeuses.researcherdesk: Researches require bookcases nearby in order to find data for their research!
typeuses.sand: Does not mix well with snakes
typeuses.scribedesk: Scribes requires 10 scroll shelves nearby in order to find data for their research!
typeuses.scrollshelf: These are 'harvested' by scribes and automatically regenerate their content. Placing 10 of them for every scribe ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.scrollshelf1: These are 'harvested' by scribes and automatically regenerate their content. Placing 10 of them for every scribe ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.scrollshelf2: These are 'harvested' by scribes and automatically regenerate their content. Placing 10 of them for every scribe ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.scrollshelffilled: These are 'harvested' by scribes and automatically regenerate their content. Placing 10 of them for every scribe ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.silicasand: Found below sand in the Heath biome
typeuses.splittingstump: A quicker way to split wood into firewood
typeuses.stove: Used to fill the surrounding area with delicious smells
typeuses.sulfur: Found deep underground in the Heath biome
typeuses.tin: Can also be found in ore beneath snowy mountains
typeuses.water: Will flood everything if let loose
typeuses.waterpump: Allows getting water without being near water
typeuses.watersponge: Removes water in its local area in a deeply realistic way
typeuses.wheat: A colonist with a grindstone will turn this into flour
typeuses.wisteriajob: One harvester needs 10 wisteria plants nearby. These plants can only be grown in heaths.
typeuses.wisteriaplant: Placing 10 of these for every wisteria harvester ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.wisteriaplantempty: Placing 10 of these for every wisteria harvester ensures a long term balance.
typeuses.wolfsbane: Prevents wolves from attacking your colony
typeuses.zinc: Can be found directly below mammoth trees.
